0I-gRYoOt5EVZ_ebA9l2hQ.text: If you're into organic eating and are in Notting Hill this is a great choice.Service can be a tad slow and the queue can be long but they make up for it with healthy and organic ingredients and a bright and airy space.  Limited groceries also for sale.

59Q4XKdOpumNSxPeQce0Ew.text: The salads are very freshand crispy. And the cake is moist and truly delicious; you can't really imaginethat it is made up of vegetables. The taste is not too sweet unlike others.Perfect place to grab for a delicious and healthy food.

kGo1K8ReelScRsPrIRnbgA.text: Came here the other weekend to have weekend brunch with some friends.  I would have to knock off a star for the lack of seats for people waiting (and you will wait if you come on a Saturday/Sunday morning) as well as the poor waitstaff who came by our table with other peoples' orders several times.  However, the food definitely balanced this aspect of the restaurant out.  The bread was high quality and my dish, Eggs Florentine, was fantastic.  Perhaps it a placebo effect, but you could taste the organic aspects of the ingredients - it tasted much lighter, cleaner and earthier.  The poached eggs were perfectly round and just the right level of firmness and the hollandaise sauce wasn't overpowering.  Even now I dream of the Eggs Florentine, I'm definitely going back again for them.

jDTTXSnBVHGBt2eW2DOcNw.text: I don't understand why they sell their milk in non-resealable pouches; but it's damn good milk, so I deal with it (hint: I got a vintage milk jug to consolidate pouches, that strikes the fancy of many a brunch/post dinner coffee guest). My other favorite of Daylesford is the hot English mustard. This will be one of those things I'll have friends ship to me, if we ever move back to the US. It really is that good! An extremely small amount goes a long way, so it took me about half-a-year to get through a jar. As for pretty much everything else, I could take it or leave it. Sifting through the veg, I often find hints of rotten spots in things like garlic. The fruit often looks underripe. I'm all for the organic, less-than-perfect fruit and veg, but I still want it to be quality. If farmers at markets can make it work, I don't think it's too much to ask for Daylesford to keep up, too. I've only eaten in breakfast, and it was very basic--eggs, yogurt, granola, etc. I realized everything we ordered, I could have made at home in a matter of minutes. It sorta turns me off lunch and dinner. For me Daylesford boils down to the milk and the mustard. I'll leave the rest, thanks.

uYKNoe7eftcDSQrMzfsBmw.text: Had Lunch here; we were very excited. Good combination of ingredients, well cooked. Good and gentle Service. Lovely athmosphere in the combination of grocery store and Restaurant. Free wifi Access for customers.The second Time we went for breakfast, which maybe was our Most expensive breakfast ever, but maybe also the best One!

oJPVPCKYR681T18-Wou-yw.text: Amazing breakfast, went here twice on a weekend getaway, when we could not get a table at granger &co. Great service, very tasty organic food. Would eat here again. Only 4 stars because it is a bit expensive

lDp50ux0JgmLD7J2dPvd2w.text: Wonderful restaurant and organic food market. I would come here for breakfast every day if I could. Delicious eggs benedict, lattes, juices.

KDfjlfzvrV9OGuePI0YBcQ.text: I came here one afternoon with a small child just after 4pm on a weekday and was told by the cashier that the cafe closed at 4pm. However, after having bought some refreshments to take away and eat in the square opposite, I noticed that guests continued to arrive, be seated and served at the cafe until well after 4.30pm. I can only conclude that I was discriminated against and find this disgraceful.

N4zAWxp1tyTCDD2fJd-Hfw.text: Great selection of foods, all organic, interesting meats, great coffeeThis is a quick review on the shop and coffee bar and not the full restaurant. I was waiting in here for about 45 minutes for a friend to show up so I browsed quite a bit. Organics aren't really my big thing so I'm not too fussed about it just because it's organic. That being said, this place had some really cool items that I'll be going back to buy.For example, few places I know sell fresh rabbit and quail, two meats which I enjoy but rarely experience cooking myself. The fresh veggies looked fantastic and heaps better than what I usually resign myself to at Sainsbury's or Tesco.The coffee bar is also well stocked with sweet treats, savoury pies and soups, and a barista who seems to know his stuff despite his relative youth. The coffee was rich and fruity with a hint of nuttiness just after the flavour peak. It was interesting and jumpstarted my hungover brain in no time at all.The one issue I had with the store was the location of the register which is at the back of the food section. Basically, I ordered my coffee, walked to the back to pay, then walked back to get it. Just seemed a bit odd.

kRRyKLPCF6SrOFrivFZc5A.text: That's for sure: I like the food. But what I do like more is the whole philosophy behind it. Starting with the fresh cooked food from their own organic farms, the carbon neutral water, bottled in the UK with PVC free bottle-caps, the nice interior and so on... Only the service could look a little bit better after the clients. One should bring time for ordering as well as paying.

gDiWlweNBRAWE3PZSJVGMg.text: This is the place if you wish to eat healthy  the food is supposed to be grown organically and I guess it is because everything tastes kind of unusually good and delicious. Recommended, even for the try.

Qap6k_CS2CROOMraADYdlw.text: Note: This review is for the restaurant part, not the store part. This is a fantastic place for brunch! I love brunch, because you can always order eggs or a hamburger, two impossibly great options. I ordered the hamburger and it was amazingly fresh and hot and delicious and it came with STREAKY BACON! And cute little jars of organic ketchup and mustard to apply to my burger plus a little green salad on the side so I didn't feel like a huge pig. Two of my dining companions ordered the eggs benny which also looked incredibly scrummy and the fourth ordered the bread basket which came with tasty looking jams. AND our table had a lovely little green garden down the middle, which we curiously wondered how they kept neat (tiny lawn mower?) and all in all it was just a great spot. HOWEVER, if you have any issues being surrounded by gorgeous children dressed better than you are, this is not the spot for you. Despite the fact I went as part of a four girl sex and the city style brunch, we were surrounded by families. If you have an aversion to little ones or just a really bad hangover, this may not be your idea of fun.

gJbhQV9kx5Kur9As3pIqbQ.text: A brilliant organic foodie lovers paradise!This place specialise in tasty organic food that's fresh and great quality. They sell cheeses, breads, pastries, cakes and other lip smacking treats - yum, yum! I would say from everything here, the cheeses are possibly their strongest point here. The selection is pretty good, it's not the cheapest but you pay for what you get and it's worth it. I love delis and when I pass through Notting Hill, I always make a stop for a nice big wedge of brie or cheddar to go with some of that fine organic bread they sell. A top place for food!

H_m1d18tX_VpZdtAN5RKgA.text: This is a review for the restaurant, not the store. I went with a friend on a Wednesday afternoon and there were seats outside but I noticed when we are leaving that there was quite a wait for seats at that point. I guess it's because we got there around noon. Get the fresh juices here! They are really refreshing - I had the carrot/apple/ginger one.  The salads were very fresh and crisp and had that earthy organic-y taste (ok maybe I'm making that up) but it didn't taste like supermarket bought veggies. I had ordered the choice of 3 salads for about 10 pounds - 1 had roasted squash, coriander, and goat cheese, another had wild rice, pine nuts, and rocket, and the last one.. well I don't remember but I cleaned my plate so I can assure you it was good.  My friend ordered the quiche with a side of the wild rice salad as well.  She said her bacon, leek and something quiche was rich, buttery and flaky (she also inhaled it pretty fast) - so that sounds like a pretty solid quiche. We also had the carrot cake and espresso.  Both were superb.  The cake was very moist and not too sweet with just enough carrot chunks so you might think for a sec... hey there's carrot in here, it's healthy!  Anyways, the cake was really good and the espresso was decent as well - it had a chocolate-y aroma with fruity accents.  Service was good - courteous and attentive, but not in your face. Additionally this place as well as other outdoor restaurants (yes 202 I'm talking about you--) on Westbourne grove are ideal for pretty people watching and not so pretty but very well dressed people watching. Oh yeah and lots of bugaboos and lunching mommies.  Enjoy!

3MHqwgjaM75Z1KCB6l7zCw.text: Another favorite neighborhood spot. The breakfast is pricey, but if you are shopping, be sure to pick up some of the amazing jams, especially the ones for meat: rosemary & apple for pork and mint for lamb. the desserts (anything chocolate) are decadent and awesome!

g5BpAbiUqnYnIun3G_LNbg.text: We came on a weekend at about mid-day. There was a wait for tables which was fine, we don't mind waiting but it was clear that they were understaffed and I hope that was the case because if that's how they always work it is a seriously inefficient way to manage the crowd of people waiting to be seated. The hostess had to keep running off to clear the tables and whilst she was away new groups of people would come, not see that there was anyone there to seat them and seat themselves. Then she would come back, see that someone had sat themselves and she would have to go tell them that there was a wait. She was annoyed (and tying her hardest not to show it), they were annoyed and this happened over and over again. Anyway, once we got sat, we had incredibly friendly service and the food was so delightful, it had a sort of energy about it. The only problem was that we ate it so fast because it was so good and then were just sat there contemplating on whether we would reorder and eat it all over again. We were sat next to the cheese counter and while were waiting for our food, we sampled some cheese and chutney. We couldn't resits buying the butternut squash chutney. It was SOOOO good! My only other complaint (and this has nothing to do with the restaurant) is that there were some SERIOUS snobs there and it was rather annoying to have to sit right next to people who complain about everything and brag about how much money they spend. We would LOVE to go back but will be careful to choose a less busy day and hopefully sit where we can have our own conversation uninterrupted by the sound of pretension.

wTLD0u1yw6ggJ__FNakfig.text: While it moved into the former home of Fresh & Wild (annoying closed down by greedy Whole Foods), I'm still surprised it took so long for Daylesford Organic to come to Notting Hill - what with its residents practically bowing to the temple of all things organic, wholesome, beautiful and expensive.  This Daylesford Organic is comprised of a shopping/deli spread over 2 small - and crowded - floors, a cafe/bar (The Bread Bar Cafe) and two restaurants:  The Larder Restaurant (serving local, seasonal food) and The Raw Bar Restaurant (serving, obviously, pure raw food).  Although this is meant to be a flagship store - and indeed, with its breakfast/lunch/dinner/drinks/shopping/takeaway options, it is impressive - the foodshop itself is a bit more limited than you may expect.  But the catch is this:  the beauty of Daylesford Organics is that it really is a farmshop of sorts, and they try to sell what is freshly picked and available. The in-house produce is of course accompanied by specialty goods made elsewhere, but it's not Whole Foods.  As much as possible is sourced from local producers and homemade (either on-site or out in the countryside).

jv9Mn8lle0akD5fqpL6Zqg.text: I've been here twice and on both occasions have had the baked eggs. I'm an admirer of simple things done well and DOs baked eggs epitomise this. The eggs were very fresh and had plump rich deep orange yokes. They were presented on the same cast iron pan they were baked in. On both occasions I've opted to have them with hollandaise and bacon. The bacon is the streaky kind cooked to deep dark brown and just crispy enough. The hollandaise was dreamy and subtle. On the side of the plate was a delicious slice of toasted sour dough bread. Each and every mouthful was pure delight.

oHB1lPeAxHhALwwykBfBWg.text: We were curious about the organic restaurant, so we ventured into this restaurant for lunch.Roast Cod was served with crushed new potato, spinach and pea purée.  The cod was fresh, flaky and was tasty, but the portion was very small.Beef Burger was nothing special, and again the potion was small.  Our waitress told us they could only cook it well-done, due to the regulation.Trifle was nothing special, and the portion again was very small.The Fruit Scones were very nice, served with clotted cream and jam.The service was polite and attentive.If you are not bothered about eating organic food, their food did not offer value for money.  We spent over £53 and left there still hungry.

1kUIpqMhFwvmTSJ2NZm2dw.text: We were shopping all morning and were getting tired, hungry and cranky when the shop girl recommends a nearby café.  She didn't seem enthusiastic and I was initially put off by the ordinary exterior of the joint.  But my wife insisted and in we went; and I was instantly convinced that this was a cool place.  The lower level is market, and bakery but the mezzanine was the café.  The service was superb and we enjoyed a very 'organic' late lunch.  For meat lovers, vegetarians and in-betweens there was all sorts of selections on the menu.  We had wine, we were transformed and spent the rest of the day shopping.  Great spot for lunch and I wouldn't be surprised if dinner was as good.  Like everything in London the prices seemed expensive for us Americans, but 50 bucks gets you a great lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. A melody of fresh salads
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Welsh rarebit
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Asparagus salad with poached egg

2Yr50KNEUE7uRHdb0a-RkQ.text: Service: Not that great...Forgot my fathers smoked salmon, than after asking for it? Took another 11 minutes. Two coffees? Never made it to the table, but showed up on the bill.Second time I'm eating here that they forgot dishes. Not great to take people here.Food is great! E*

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom

LF7SS_rWhaMuBf6EnwXdPw.text: What a great place.  As far as service,  they are very accomodating.   We went to this restaurant for lunch.  The food is superb.   We started with the bread and olives.  They serve a mixture of olives, cornichons,  peers and chunks of garlic.   It comes with their own baked bread.  We also ordered the cauliflower and gruyere soup which we realized that it might be served in a large bowl so we asked if we could share it between the two of us.  The soup was amazing and worth every calorie. In addition we ordered the flat iron chicken which was tender and very tasty. Of course we over ordered by adding the cottage pie.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.   The atmosphere is very earthy and relaxing.  They also have a small market in the front.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom

9O89Od1BxZWu291bxa8qRA.text: Good wifi Internet, organic healthy food and good ambience.I love this place.This is a combined breakfast/lunch place and speciality supermarket, they stock a great selection of organic food and non-food.I have to admit, the groceries are expensive enough for me not to be a regular, but the food is quite good and fairly priced. Living around the corner, I tend to pop by a lot.If you're into salads (the only thing I've really had here and highly recommendable) why only settle for one? You can combine up to three different salads, and they all taste quite good.They have seating inside, but if you're a party of 1-2, the best place to hang out is by the window people watching.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. 3 salads in one - and yummi!

lRUABu1y--ksjqBMLbRxtA.text: I do not recommend this place, it's over price and the service quality is bad.My mom and I were walking around Nothing Hill and we were really hung so we decided to stop at this little shop/resto that looks super inviting starting from my green juice which they pour 4 fingers of it in a coup and that's it and they charge you 6 pounds for it. I also had to ask for water about 3 times.the server could not explain me how was the eggs done neither which plate was the one my neighbour was having. So we other a scramble egg in a toast, the portion was so so and tasteless (we wonder how can a scramble egg go so wrong), it came with ONE small piece of bread.in the end we left the place very unhappy and the paid 24, something for two eggs, a tea and a green juice.

9ar34gAae5uvwpYHPObbzw.text: Breakfast...Ham & Poached Eggs with hollandaise sauce...croissant & two coffees.Everything delicious. Eggs were perfect. Nice room and friendly attentive service. Coffee very good...seems you have to go somewhere above average to get decent tasting coffee in London. But the cost...twenty pounds including tip seems a bit hefty for breakfast, however nice it was. I'd expect to pay that if I was sitting in a five star hotel, not in some dining room attached to a deli-shop.

ya7QXs-zYxdL3-27FZJLHg.text: I like the concept of this restaurant (all organic food) and the food sure was tasty.  However,I left quite hungry because the portions were small.  The roast cod tasted lovely and the burgher meat was fantastic but they didn't come with chips so we were both hungry when we had finished the meal.  For dessert the trifle was nice but without sherry.  You have to have deep pocket to fill up with food at this restaurant.  I have no complaint about the food at this restaurant but there should be more of it.

Vxdi1v6PlqF9l2YoGgUhdg.text: A bit spendy!! Tasty if not small portions. Location is lovely and the adjacent shop has some fun offerings. Overall food is fresh, menu is seasonal, ambience is pleasant. 3 out of 5 stars.

IsJzmwOvXRn6e0PMDZzUmA.text: Beautiful, chic place with good food. I'm a bit ambivalent about the five stars because my positive memories of this place stems mainly from the extraordinarily beautiful, intelligent, wonderful woman I had lunch with at this location, whom I've only seen twice in my life, and was thus distracted from really evaluating the food. I have vague memories that the food was excellent, the service was efficient, and the decor and ambiance really nice and upscale.

VfI4TZSV37uMk4JstjSJsg.text: Amazing amazing shop, and the restaurant is incredible too. Food was interesting yet unfussy. Also, maybe the best cold-pressed juice i've ever had. Only problem was the service. We went for lunch and got seated immediately. Our waitress was only serving the two of us and somehow managed to cause confusion at every turn. She asked for our orders, then asked us to repeated them twice and left without writing them down.Five minutes later food and drinks that we hadn't ordered arrived. This was a case of the wrong food at the right table. Waitress hadn't bothered to pay attention the first two times, so she had to send all the food back and take our order again. Eventually the manager had to come over, clear up the mess and take our order for a fourth time. Annoying and unprofessional, but won't stop me from going back.

An6LrrCbCMLVFb01UwPStw.text: If you can stand queuing the best part of 45 minutes on a weekend morning to sit down and eat here, do it!The food is fantastic and once you get a seat, the service is good too! They have a good selection of offerings all from the Daylesford farm, both prepared on site and as ingredients for you to take away and use for your own cooking.If this branch is too busy you could try the one in Belgravia but it's just as bad for queues (and just as good for food)!

aKbd5RId30k6Q8rnff4YyQ.text: Daylesford Organic is another great place for breakfast (and lunch too!) in fashionable Notting Hill. But beyond the trendy it offers delicious and wholesome food -and some outstanding scrambled eggs. They even convinced me to try a carrot-ginger juice that I really enjoyed and I am not adventurous when it comes to carrot in my morning beverage. So those of you shy of going in because the organic label puts you off or you think there may be a wee bit too many sprouts on your plate, don't be, this is seriously good food -for every palette. And super friendly service as well so you will feel very relaxed and at ease.

9mS1kS_26D2XINec-MeU0A.text: Went for breakfast on a weekday - Had a really good service. Beautiful decoration and atmosphere, fresh ingredients. Food wasn't as good as I expected though. Orange juice was very very bitter, I actually thought it was grapefruit at first. I like it, but pressed oranges typically give out more sugar where I come from  I guess!Pancakes absolutely excellent but the blackcurrant jam was very sour. no additives or sugar of course but even with that it was surprising.French chocolatine (chocolate croissant) was a total disgrace though. Really dry, and I'm french, it was a bit disappointing. Cold and hard doesn't suit a French pastry :)But really nice for the ambiance and quality of ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Farmhouse breakfast
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes

T9KuO92IH8mBC73bAOAC7Q.text: Great yogurt and home goods selection! Nice atmosphere. Next time I will order some food and wine and spend more time here

nYcDkbAphSXgpb-babFaZA.text: I must admit that the shop looks beautiful, and actually a lot more attractive than its previous incarnations. However, what used to be a local wholefoods store affordable enough to do your entire shopping, then taken over by Fresh & Wild just to be closed down when Wholefoods opened in Kensington, is now more a treat sort of place.The transformation seems to be in keeping with the time and neighbourhood as the shop is usually teeming with people, especially in the cafe areas.Oh well, at least it is still a food store rather than yet another fashion outlet.

2f42SdBJULkHami7OcRCSA.text: Went to the Esher location this afternoon for lunch.  I had the Daylesford house salad and it was awesome.  The proscuitto was so fresh!  And the figs... Ugh, I love figs.  The service was fantastic, the coffee delicious, and was overall a really good experience.Minus one star for no wifi.  I know you guys are new, but please fix this!!

gYUQdWPt43C4xea23npHTw.text: My go to for coffee each morning (which is always really good). Fabulous little restaurant area above the shop, in which the scrambled eggs are to die for, avocado & tomato on sourdough is one of the nicest dishes I've ever had, and the bacon is farm-grown. A must for brunch if you're in the area.

HRpK2WVI8uqWSc7mkWL2yQ.text: I like the concept of this place but food and service were not up to my expectationsNot worth another visit in my opinion

u_yw1YGVSMQDlIihRNhKTA.text: Adorable lunch spot/market. The place is very cute and the decor is great. It is a fairly busy restaurant so I recommend getting there earlyish if you plan on going for lunch. There were a handful of people posted up with their laptops working and I can imagine it would be a nice place to work or study. I selected three of the salads from the salad selection, they were all great. I especially loved the carrot, beetroot slaw with an asian ginger soy dressing. It was delicious and I could have definitely eaten a whole bowl of that one alone. The salad was a good sized portion and next time I would pass on the bread basket, it was decent but nothing memorable. I definitely plan on going back.

A82K5DkwyEMJhVGy-9qkHQ.text: Adorable spot!!! It is a beautiful store on my favorite street in London. It is a nice place to pick up fresh produce and goodies - they merchandise the store so well! It is also a perfect place to grab a latte and a pastry and sit outside and people watch. I've popped in and out casually to do those two things plenty of times!More recently I ate in for brunch. I ordered the avocado toast and it was excellent! Staff was very attentive and it was a lively atmosphere.

0ot_aWram9fYTt89e4Y9gw.text: The ingredients comes straight from the farm and food was AMAZING. It was rich in flavor and the waiters were all kind. I enjoyed walking around the market and there's even a book dedicated to their mission statement. Never had anything like it, I will come back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom

RIm5YbKuMKoqi0r5-gtDww.text: I would have given this place 3.5 stars if I could, but I can't, so I gave it 3 stars. It took me a very long time to choose what I wanted (There were not many options on the menu) The service was ok, it was about averageThe food was delicious! I got the berries and an almond croissantThe atmosphere was The comfort was good Quality! There were green cushions on all the seats!+2 for good food+1 for good comfort+1 good service

-BOhchrkNpfR7in4yryj4A.text: Wow. We were looking for organic quality food while visiting London. This place was super fresh and great quality. Highly recommend this place for a great lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom

eNW4e62RGm2sLpQib4qWyw.text: Grabbed a couple to-go items and sat by the window. The food is healthy, high-quality and pretty tasty, although quite pricey. The interior of the shop is inviting and clean. I tried the black quinoa salad with veggies and subtly smoky veggie patties. It was pretty flavorful and satisfying for a light meal. I also tried the hardboiled eggs, which were perfectly cooked. The tiny bottled smoothies are just alright (and super expensive). I would probably skip the smoothie next time around.Overall a nice spot to grab some healthy snacks or a light meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Black quinoa salad with veggies, subtly smoky veggie patties, perfectly cooked hardboiled eggs

3qrjj8tp8RCFsqDwOJbwAg.text: Absolutely lovely cafe/market. Very clean and organized. I got their homemade kefir as we were on the go. They have lots of treats and snacks. I enjoy how sustainable and conscious their farming practices are.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Loved this place
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom

cmOOIRrFhs3eqc6xPHFf5w.text: Had brunch this morning at this place. Lovely shop at the entrance where you can can buy groceries l. All organic ingredients are from their farm about 2 hours away. I had two poached eggs on smashed avocado on a slice of gluten free toast with a side is summer veggies salad. All clean tasting and what I needed. The staff was great. The assistant manager helped tailor my meal to make sure it was gluten free, dairy free and free of night shades. Love it! Super cute and what I was looking for when far away from home and staying on my dietary restrictions due to my health.

BM-_EdjKUfXSORRv3k_DJg.text: The boo and I were playing tourist in Notting Hill last Saturday and after hours of wandering into antique stores, we were famished. We went on Yelp and initially wanted to go to Granger & Co, but after seeing the long line, we headed for Daylesford Organic. I am thrilled we did because the food was delicious, healthy, and just what we wanted. We had a 20 minute wait, during which time we perused the menu, sampled some cheese and beetroot cured salmon, and poked around the shop.We decided to share the: B Renewed Smoothie; Natural Yogurt Bowl; Avocado on Toast; and Super Greens, Orchard, Daylesford Caesar salad trio. The smoothie was so good! It was basically an acai bowl in liquid form, yum yum yum. A bit pricey considering it was only 250ml, but I hadn't had acai in a while so it was worth it. I love Avocado Toast (I know: basic alert!) and this one was no exception. The egg was perfectly poached and the avocado majorly yum. Similar to with the smoothie, portions were a bit small for price, but everything here is organic and really fresh. Plus, I guess I shouldn't be comparing it to what I get in the U.S. The salad trio was lovely. The Orchard salad was so flavorful and fresh, and the the kale just the right amount of crunchy. The Caesar salad was surprisingly good and the egg really fresh. The Super Greens was decent, but I really just wanted more of the Orchard. The yogurt was solid too. Perfect portions of everything featuring delicious crunchy granola and a nice light, tart yogurt.Despite my earlier comment about portions, the boo and I were both super full at the end of the meal (guess we did order a lot of food). The service was great and our food came out reasonably quickly. Would definitely come back for both the cute shop and some more delicious brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Avocado Toast
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. B Renewed Smoothie
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Restaurant interior

yTEylADDpp3j0gA3U0jH8g.text: Lovely, lovely setting for food and shopping in the swank Nottinghill. Much of the food hales from their farm and is served in a white washed, contemporary, rustic farm decor. All organic menu and all dietary restrictions can be met. Menu is created by a nutritionist and includes foods for detox. Be sure to shop about for nosh and specialty food and home items (think organic dean and deluca) while you wait for your brunch table.  When this review started I gave them 5 stars. By the end of the review it dropped to a 4. We waited about 40 min for our breakfast; poached eggs, scrambled eggs and 2 vegetable sides. Although the server did come by once to say the kitchen was a bit backed up. Really disappointing as the food was just " good".  We really did enjoy the setting. The baked food we bought for takeaway were honestly the best we had in London. Tried an earl Grey fruit cake. So tasty and moist with perfect bits of fruit. Only 1.49 quid! Same low price for an amazing raisin scone. Would love to have some in ny! Hope to try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Adorable interior.

QrPI8TQ_0Bzqt-GdPlP1bA.text: They lose a star for completely messing up my drink order...  I asked for a tumeric shot and got a latte instead and the guy who brought me the drink insisted it was the right thing. The bill came later and turns out I was right. Other than that I had the eggs Benedict which was really good. Eggs were poached perfectly. But the little side of greens was sad. The wait wasn't too long but at least it was fun killing time in the store part and seeing all the goodies they sell.

h5LrLB7eua3Q8P90dd49Fg.text: This place is a dream. I wish I could go everyday. Also, the best chicken soup I've ever had! Don't forget to stock up on all the organic produce & baked goods as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom

CGly_GT9US-51BectF-ZdQ.text: I didn't have time to eat in the Cafe upstairs but the menu looked fabulous for breakfast, lunch, or brunch.  The food shop (on the main floor) has amazing high-quality organic produce, meats, cheese, diary, oils, wine, bakery, and packaged products.  The home-store area downstairs has great gift items for both home and garden. The take-away dishes looked healthy and delicious. I look forward to going back for another visit.  The store has a calendar of planned events and workshops.  They also offer Floristry Courses throughout the year. daylesford.com. daylesford.com/events

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom

TLs6_XifN8IVB0r9VcLZdw.text: Ahhh! I love Daylesford. The food that they serve is absolutely delicious, beautiful, and it comes from their farm! I love that! I've tried their brunch and salads, and the service has always been nice and the food always delicious.

SwXO9M-RpPVN8v-QhkrOGw.text: Looking for a place to brunch in Notting Hill, Daleysford seemed to offer yummy options...yummy options yes...but expensive ones for small portions...I should have paid more attention to this, and to some reviews.The food is good but the price is not justified, and beware of the sides too as they will charge £2.50 for half an avocado and the same for some slices of tomatoes. I know this is Notting Hill but it doesn't justify to charge £3 for the double espresso my friend had....£3?? Seriously?? What's in it??...I don't see how a place can justify a double espresso at this price (It's not even that expensive at Duck & Waffle and you get at least a nice view while drink your more expensive than average coffee)Even if the setting is nice, I am for sure won't go back as this is too much overpriced...I am happy to pay more sometimes but I need to see why, and I couldn't see it here.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Small portions...

mgiM5nTvF_evCeaeezWLtQ.text: Wonderful salads. Friendly wait staff. Highly recommend for a nice lunch would definitely come back next time we're in Notting Hill.

iB1dBUiisi_jAoaFQeiqCw.text: This is one of the popular cafe in Notting Hill. You can see people waiting to be seated most of the times.  However, take into consideration that they have a flow so you can find a table after a short wait. On my last visit I had scrambled eggs with sourdough bread what came with butter and jam for brunch! I am not a yoghurt person and scrambled eggs were the only option for me. They have a really good healthy and simple menu all with organic products.  It is well situated in Notting Hill and brightly decorated. When you enter in organic fruits and vegs are welcoming along with daily baked breads. They have sections; butcher, creamery, grocer, fishmonger, dairy, wine. One floor down you can find homeware section and etc. Overall it is a very cool cafe but definitely not my favourite. I prefer to visit just for tea and pain au chocolate.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs

nDTonDomR8sGt5OaEs30lA.text: How could I go have brunch in this restaurant without reading the warning of one of my Yelp friend ? Ok, I have to admit we were really hungry and we're waiting for ages in front of Granger & Co when we decided to go somewhere else...The first place we saw was this organic shop and restaurant, which seemed great.But beware... All the food is really expensive. I had the vegetarian quiche of the day with 2 choices of salad and the portion was so tiny ! I don't get it : quiche is one of the cheapest meal to cook...It's sad, because the food itself was tasty.My friend had the eggs and toast and were very disappointed with the small portion as well. The only good thing for them was the chocolate cake they had for dessert, and for me it was the prune and apple juice, which was pretty original.I wouldn't recommend this place. Yes, Notting Hill is expensive, but it doesn't mean I have to get out of a place and be still starving.

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Tiny quiche

omzeL2bl7QDV9ieO_mpndQ.text: I love love love this restaurant. Clean farm to table daily produce. The interiors are so clean as well. For an organic restaurant, this definitely is one for the books. Lots of happy people and the food is simple and amazing. I wish there was something like this in Manila. Seriously organic and seriously good food. I love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom. Fresh produce available at this restaurant.
Photo of Daylesford Organic - London, United Kingdom

jjspWR-0WU_-9WArStm6LQ.text: Stopped here for a late evening coffee warm-up during the festive period.  Was easily able to get in and be seated, however I imagine this is not the case during more popular times due to the general proximity to Portobello Rd market.  As a "hot beverage averse" person with an irrational fear of burning my tongue, I was a fan of their mocha preparation; they nailed the perfect temperature!  I also tasted the chai-spiced hot chocolate which was a nice twist on the classic.

3uU6bwxgMbI0qEGJK3AH3g.text: Daylesford appeared through a steady downpour of rain in Notting Hill one day and we were so grateful to find it! After attempting to sift through the few legitimate weekday shopping options on Portobello Road, we decided to grab some lunch. Before we could reach our destination, the rain picked up and we ducked into Daylesford, primarily seeking shelter, but ultimately discovering a culinary feast! We kept it light with the soup of the day (tomato) and shared several salads. The best was the green bean salad - I forget the name now - with a mustard vinaigrette and some semi-dried tomatoes and garlic. I tried to replicate this at home soon after, but couldn't do it justice. All the food tasted so fresh and was not too heavy. There's a shop up front where you can buy produce from the farm and a boutique downstairs with some unique gift items and kitchen/housewares. All-in-all a 5-star stop!
